revised_title: An In-Depth Study of Caudal Fins in Fishes
tldr: The author examines the caudal fins of over a hundred different fish species, representing various sub-groups of Teleosts, Ganoids, and Elasmobranchs. They classify the fins into three main types: protocercal, heterocercal, and homocercal, and discuss their internal and external symmetries, endoskeletal supports, and evolutionary development. The study provides a clearer understanding of the caudal fin's role in fish anatomy and taxonomy.
